column5: Found this in FB. Beware you Muskie guys.
Omg!!!!   Off to emerg he goes!  Geezzz..... I've have my share of hook jabs, but that one looks almost scary!
Seen that on pete mainas fb  Damn, painkillers needed (your not pushing that one through)  Thats beyond gnarly
The red in the middle of the bucktail is blood? Hope you had the good bolt cutters for muskies so the hook can be pushed out through the point.
No, don't push it through, give it a quick tug out, I don't think Mike is going to use this, this surprisingly didn't hurt at all, and yeah I'm a baby
Chris that not your skull lol  But yes ive done the same as you with smaller hooks a few times  Look at my sons near miss?
cringe....and that's why I troll when I have newbie's on board. Back in my pike days one of my yahoo buddies beened my off the forehead with a 5 o diamonds. That was bad enough
YYyuup  nothing like a lure brushing your face to make it trolling time.
That's why I like my 20' boat so there is some distance in between me and the other guy lol That said I still got smacked with a bait, luckily no penetration!

About 10 years ago a group of us from this board got together for a friendly little musky tournament.  I'd never actually met my partner till the day of the tourney and 15 minutes after we started fishing he made a mighty 2 handed cast but forgot to hit the thumb bar, the bait swung around and he clubbed me in the back of the head with a 7" solid wood musky bait called a Wakemaker.  If you can imagine getting hit with a baseball bat, that's what it felt like and I saw stars for an hour. Luckily the big 7/0 hooks missed my scalp and the pain wasn't nearly as bad as you'd think.  He felt terrible...obviously...but it was an accident and within a few minutes we were laughing about it.  Best part though, was I went on to win the tourney and pocketed $50 for my troubles and that made it all worthwhile
Someone I fish with a lot got a hook close to the brain as well....    ... When he sat down on his own lure.   My job:  1. Stop laughing  2. Get camera and take picture  3. Remove hooks
Ah, it's just a flesh wound, I've had worse
Had to cut one out of my dads hand last weekend or it would have ended the trip a few days early.   Not pleasant.

I was on a fly in trip with 3 other buddies, one of them got stuck with a treble hook right into his thumb behind the thumb nail, buried to the hilt. I will never forget the sound of ripping tissue when we yanked the hook out with pliers back at camp. He had a few shots of liquid courage but he said it still hurt like h**l. It was our last day in so we flew out the next day, thank goodness we had a first aid kit with cleaning and disinfecting fluids.
